description.S1: Investigate Roseway to find potential company secrets that could be sold to the highest bidder through Gladys.
description.S2: Talking to the scientists around the town would probably be a good place to start.

blurb.B1: After landing at Roseway Landing Pad, you'll make your way through a desolate street and enter Roseway proper.
blurb.B2: If you speak with Orson Shaw and offer to help then you will get the objective to get a hold of his weapon plans.
blurb.B3: These can be found in the Storage Facility to the southeast of Roseway.
blurb.B4: Head to Roseway Communications Room and you can meet Anton Crane, who sent the distress call.
blurb.B5: He reveals that his work might not be entirely legal,
blurb.B6: so corporate cannot know of what has happened.
blurb.B7: You can intimidate (25) to get him to tell you what is going on.
blurb.B8: He's tasked with formulating new and improved dental gel,
blurb.B9: and they accidentally discovered an appetite suppresant.
blurb.B10: He claims a group of malcontents attacked them,
blurb.B11: freed the Raptidons and stole his research.
blurb.B12: You will get 3300xp for agreeing to help,
blurb.B13: and obtain Anton's Lab Keycard and Anton's Pass Code.
blurb.B14: He will also mention you should not kill the Raptidon mother,
blurb.B15: and that the old lab has Jameson, his protege.
blurb.B16: Agree to find him and you'll obtain the quest By His Bootstraps.

description.S1: The schematics for Orson's prototype would likely be valuable to Gladys.

blurb.B1: These can be found in the Storage Facility to the southeast of Roseway.
blurb.B2: Head there, defeat the marauders and loot it from the basement wall.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: Ah. Outlaws, I assume. Do me a favor and let me finish this, will you? And then--make it quick, please.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What are you talking about?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm not here to kill you.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I can see you're busy. I'll leave you to it.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: Aren't you with the brutes that attacked our lab? Aren't you here to pillage our supplies and leave our corpses to the raptidons?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm here to help. Someone sent out a distress call.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I heard there was a bit of trouble here and thought I'd check it out.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: It's none of your business who I am.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: ...oh. Well. Good luck.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: [The scientist seems to have forgotten you're there.]

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Hello?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What are you doing there?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Who are you, anyway?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Uh... thanks.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: Oh. You're still here. If you haven't already, you might speak to Anton. He can point you in the right direction.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: What does it look like? I'm preparing a personal defense device. Or ... trying to, anyway.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Need a hand?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: That looks pretty lethal. Are you allowed to mess with tech like that?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Oh, don't mind me, then. I'll get out of your hair.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: No. Well, yes. Well... no. Perhaps.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: I left schematics in our storage facility. As far as I know, the security commander hasn't found them yet. I admit I'd feel better were they returned to me.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Sure, I'll see what I can find.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Care to elaborate?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Where is this storage facility?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I don't have time.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: Say, you wouldn't happen to have a tube of thermal paste on you, would you?

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: Blast. Well, good luck. I hope I see you back here in one piece.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: I found an advanced pistol when we moved here, but it's broken. I need those schematics to modify it to output superheated air. It should quite easily burn through raptidon hides.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: Out the south gate, follow the road. It'll be on the left, past the old lab.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: Certainly not. But Porter and his goons are busy with the outlaws and Anton's busy holding his head in his hands. Seems as good a time as any to get a bit of work done.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: I am Orson Shaw, chief behavioral scientist.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: I was brought in to study the raptidons. I was to ensure that, should a problem arise, our team is adequately equipped to deal with them.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What'd you learn?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Seems like a waste of time to me. Just shoot the things.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: They are insatiably hungry, absolutely impossible to control in any fashion, and indeed appear to be powered entirely by hate.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: No amount of studying will enable us to control them--or even slightly sate their aggression.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: So your research amounted to nothing?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: And now they're loose. Great.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: Not quite. We are now acutely aware of their weaknesses – bullets through the head.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Well, good to know.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: The head! I never would've thought of that.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: All your research amounted to... shooting them in the head?

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: That may seem an obvious conclusion, but believe it or not, some creatures' brains are not in their heads.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: Indeed. Now that you fully grasp the gravity of the situation, I wonder if you might do me a favor.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What do you need?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I don't have the time, but maybe I'll stop by later.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: As a matter of fact, I agree.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: Too right. Carry on.

dialog.speaker: OrsonShaw (Male)
dialog.utterance: Oh. You aren't with the outlaws? Who are you, then?
